title: Cell Structure
summary: Cells are the basic units of life. They contain structures like the nucleus, mitochondria, and cell membrane that help the cell function.
sample_question: What are the main parts of a cell and what do they do?

title: Photosynthesis
summary: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide into glucose and oxygen.
sample_question: Explain how sunlight and chlorophyll help in photosynthesis.

title: DNA
summary: DNA is the genetic material that carries instructions for growth, development, and functioning of living organisms.
sample_question: What is DNA and why is it important for living organisms?
